English: Hidden in the mist
Remote Soviet camp
Thank you both for coming. We have matters to discuss.
Our successful defence means we are on the offensive and victory on Kolguyev is only a matter of time.\nWe must start to look into the future.

Stas reported me on your adventures on Everon, Sergei.\nIt is partly the reason why I promoted.\nI say partly because I saw your qualities first hand and Vadim's son cannot be anything but extraordinary.
Thank you, Grigory. You flatter me.
I wanted to meet so we can explain to you what is going on behind the scenes. Stas, you take it from here.

There is a great tension in the world right now.\nFight for Everon is one thing, but NATO actually attacked a Sovet island.\nUnlike the first time, we didn't put a foot on Malden and NATO is now seen more as an aggresor.

The Kremlin was divided whether to support our effort here, but when we came close to actually losing the island, an army was sent.\nAll forces are under command of Vladimir Volkov and his dogs, namely Zubarev.
Now the question being what does Volkov plan to do with his newfound power.\nHe already had a sway in the Kremlin which just increased considerably.
Do you think his aim is another world war? Like Livanoch?
Volkov certainly seems to have taken notes from Livanoch's book.\nUntil he takes Malden though he cannot launch a nuclear strike, we should be grateful we are still on Kolguyev then.

We want you to join us, Sergei. If Volkov goes against the Kremlin, if he does go for the nuclear destruction, we must be there to stop him.\nAnother world war means an end for everyone, not only for the west. It must not happen.

I understand, of course. My father sent me a lot of letters from the front before he got killed.\nHe would frequently mention the war was short sighted and could lead to an annihilation. I wasn't sure what he meant until I learned about Livanoch's plan.

I think my father was against it. Maybe even tried to stop it. I see it in the same light, it would be a disaster of unprecedented magnitude.\nFather always spoke highly of you, Grigory, and I trust you. I am with you.

Thank you, I appreciate it. but beware, we are on a thin ice. Technically what we're doing could be considered a treachery against Volkov.\nWe must be careful, learn more about his plans, expose him and if necessary, stop him before he does whatever his endgoal is.
I understand and I am with you. I am Vadim's son, I will not let this happen as long as I breathe.

Excellent. Then welcome, Sergei. We should stay low for now and gather more information. Stas has some contacts back in Moscow, we'll se what he can dig up. Me and you will keep both our eyes open. We must know what Volkov's plan is before we can stop it.
I agree.
Absolutely.
Don't tell anyone what was discussed here and don't meet publicly more than necessary. Do not underestimate Volkov, he is very dangerous.\nStay safe until our next meeting.
Come on lads, enough lollygagging. Time to earn your pay.
Comrade major, we follow you. In case you need any more charges, we have some in those crates.

Exit Point
Checkpoint Cleared
